intro: Adoxa moschatellina f. japonica, commonly known as Japanese mosquito plant, is a herbaceous perennial native to East Asia. It features slender, erect stems with small, white to pale purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its unique appearance and delicate flowers make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
